title: Folder Tree
description: The FolderTree component is a customizable UI element for displaying and interacting with hierarchical file systems. Ideal for applications needing folder structures, it allows users to create collapsible directories and organize files with ease.

body.raw:
# FolderTree Component Documentation ## Overview The `FolderTree` component is a customizable folder structure UI component that allows users to represent and interact with a hierarchical file system. ## Preview and Code Snippet Preview Code

layout.tsx

page.tsx

 ```tsx

layout.tsx

page.tsx

 ``` ## Props ### FolderTree Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | | ------------ | -------- | ------- | ----------------------------------- | | `className` | `string` | `-` | Additional classes for styling | | `indentSize` | `number` | `16` | Indentation size for nested folders | ### Folder Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | | ------------- | --------- | ------- | ------------------------------------ | | `element` | `string` | `-` | Name of the folder | | `defaultOpen` | `boolean` | `false` | Determines if the folder starts open | | `className` | `string` | `-` | Additional classes for styling | ### File Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | | ----------- | -------- | ------- | ------------------------------ | | `className` | `string` | `-` | Additional classes for styling | ## Usage Steps 1. **Wrap files and folders inside the `FolderTree` component.** 2. **Use the `Folder` component to create a collapsible directory.** 3. **Place `File` components inside `Folder` to represent files.** 4. **Use `defaultOpen` to control initial visibility.** ### Example ```tsx

Button.tsx

index.tsx

 ```
